...and a number of tests are failing with this exception.
Eugene, are you seeing these too?
Upon opening second monitor task list goes blank in first window and these exceptions (see description) are thrown.
do you get the same error when opening new window (Window / New Window) and making Task List view to appear on bot of them (even on the same screen)?
Missed your question. No, I haven't seen it, but haven't tried to run tests for some time...

So far this is what I'm seeing: With two workbenches, same physical monitor, initially second opens and tasklist is visible in both. Upon activating a task in second window's task list, first window's task list goes blank. Activation results in focus being brought to first work bench window.

(In reply to comment #6)
> So far this is what I'm seeing: With two workbenches, same physical monitor,
> initially second opens and tasklist is visible in both. Upon activating a task
> in second window's task list, first window's task list goes blank. Activation
> results in focus being brought to first work bench window.

Not a big surprise to me, knowing how it is implemented. I've tried to submit patch for that at some point (bug 151432), but it didn't go trough. The thing is that each window has its own instance of the Task List, so those static methods don't really.
Fixed.  This was introduced by the problems discussed on bug 199342.
